Package ca.cmput301t05.placeholder.events

Class Event

java.lang.Object
ca.cmput301t05.placeholder.database.utils.DocumentSerializable
ca.cmput301t05.placeholder.events.Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Event extends DocumentSerializable implements Serializable
Represents an event, including information about the event name, organizer, date, and attendees. Supports serialization for Firebase database storage and retrieval.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      Default constructor that generates a new event with unique ID and empty attendee list.

    • Event

      public Event(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot snapshot)

    • Event

      public Event(UUID eventID)
      Constructor that initializes an event with a specific UUID. Intended for use when retrieving an existing event from the database.
      Parameters:
      eventID - The UUID of the event.

    • Event

      public Event(String name, String eventInfo, int maxAttendees)
      Constructor that creates a new event with the specified name, information, and maximum number of attendees. Generates unique ID for the event and QR codes for event information and check-in.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the event.
      eventInfo - The detailed information about the event.
      maxAttendees - The maximum number of attendees allowed for this event.

    • checkIn

      public void checkIn(Profile profile, Double longitude, Double latitude)
      Attempts to check in an attendee to the event. If the maximum number of attendees has been reached, no more attendees can be checked in.
      Parameters:
      profile - The profile of the attendee trying to check in.
      longitude - The longitude of user when he checked in
      latitude - The latitude of user when he checked in

      Sets the attendees for the event.
      Parameters:
      attendees - A HashMap where the key is the attendee's profile ID as a String, and the value is the number of times they've checked in.
